text: the Indian elections one of the largest
exercises in democracy in the world with
814 million registered to vote this year
will see more people vote in India than
in the last six US elections combined
the number of parties contesting
elections has rocketed over the past few
decades and the five years since the
last parliamentary election have seen
India's electoral roll increased by over
100 million more than the population of
the Philippines so who are these new
voters it is estimated that 20% of the
electorate will be eligible to vote for
the first time another country with an
average age of just under 27 years
India's youth have found themselves
center stage with many citing rising
prices as their biggest concern
as the cost of consumer goods is rising
many will want a leader who can ensure
the country's economy stays afloat but
widespread corruption means that many
have lost faith in India's political
elite 30% of elected MPs have criminal
cases registered against them of which
almost half are serious charges
including murder and abduction of the
total funding gathered by the sex
national parties 75% came from
undisclosed sources many feel that
Indian politics is in need of a shaker
but soon to be home to a fifth of the
world's working age population the
crucial question will be who can be
trusted to make sure the country's
economy is on the right track
